com.algolia.search.saas

Class Client

  • Object
    • com.algolia.search.saas.Client
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OfflineClient

    public class Client
extends Object

    Entry point to the Android API. You must instantiate a Client object with your application ID and API key to start using Algolia Search API.

    WARNING: For performance reasons, arguments to asynchronous methods are not cloned. Therefore, you should not modify mutable arguments after they have been passed (unless explicitly noted).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  Client.LibraryVersion
      A version of a software library.
      static class  Client.MultipleQueriesStrategy
      Strategy when running multiple queries.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client(@NonNull
              String applicationID,
              @NonNull
              String apiKey)

        Create a new Algolia Search client targeting the default hosts.

        NOTE: This is the recommended way to initialize a client is most use cases.

        Parameters:
        applicationID - The application ID (available in your Algolia Dashboard).
        apiKey - A valid API key for the service.

      • Client

        public Client(@NonNull
              String applicationID,
              @NonNull
              String apiKey,
              @Nullable
              String[] hosts)

        Create a new Algolia Search client with explicit hosts to target.

        NOTE: In most use cases, you should the default hosts. See Client(String, String).

        Parameters:
        applicationID - The application ID (available in your Algolia Dashboard).
        apiKey - A valid API key for the service.
        hosts - An explicit list of hosts to target, or null to use the default hosts.

                      String name,

        Set an HTTP header that will be sent with every request.

        Parameters:
        name - Header name.
        value - Value for the header. If null, the header will be removed.

      • initIndex

        public Index initIndex(@NonNull
                       String indexName)
        Deprecated. You should now use getIndex(String), which re-uses instances with the same name.

        Create a proxy to an Algolia index (no server call required by this method).

        Parameters:
        indexName - The name of the index.
        Returns:
        A new proxy to the specified index.

public Index getIndex(@NonNull

        Parameters:
        indexName - The name of the index.
        Returns:
        A proxy to the specified index.

      • hasUserAgent

        public boolean hasUserAgent(@NonNull
                            Client.LibraryVersion userAgent)

        Test whether a user agent is declared.

        Parameters:
        userAgent - The user agent to look for.
        Returns:
        true if it is declared on this client, false otherwise.

      • listIndexesAsync

        public Request listIndexesAsync(@NonNull
                                CompletionHandler completionHandler)

        List existing indexes.

        Parameters:
        completionHandler - The listener that will be notified of the request’s outcome.
        Returns:
        A cancellable request.

                                String indexName,
                                CompletionHandler completionHandler)

        Delete an index.

        Parameters:
        indexName - Name of index to delete.
        completionHandler - The listener that will be notified of the request’s outcome.
        Returns:
        A cancellable request.

      • moveIndexAsync

        public Request moveIndexAsync(@NonNull
                              String srcIndexName,
                              @NonNull
                              String dstIndexName,
                              CompletionHandler completionHandler)

        Move an existing index. If the destination index already exists, its specific API keys will be preserved and the source index specific API keys will be added.

        Parameters:
        srcIndexName - Name of index to move.
        dstIndexName - The new index name.
        completionHandler - The listener that will be notified of the request’s outcome.
        Returns:
        A cancellable request.

      • copyIndexAsync

        public Request copyIndexAsync(@NonNull
                              String srcIndexName,
                              @NonNull
                              String dstIndexName,
                              CompletionHandler completionHandler)

        Copy an existing index. If the destination index already exists, its specific API keys will be preserved and the source index specific API keys will be added.

        Parameters:
        srcIndexName - Name of index to copy.
        dstIndexName - The new index name.
        completionHandler - The listener that will be notified of the request’s outcome.
        Returns:
        A cancellable request.

      • multipleQueriesAsync

        public Request multipleQueriesAsync(@NonNull
                                    List<IndexQuery> queries,
                                    Client.MultipleQueriesStrategy strategy,
                                    @NonNull
                                    CompletionHandler completionHandler)

        Run multiple queries, potentially targeting multiple indexes, with one API call.

        Parameters:
        queries - The queries to run.
        strategy - The strategy to use.
        completionHandler - The listener that will be notified of the request’s outcome.
        Returns:
        A cancellable request.

        public Request batchAsync(@NonNull
                          JSONArray operations,
                          CompletionHandler completionHandler)

        Batch operations.

        Parameters:
        operations - List of operations.
        completionHandler - The listener that will be notified of the request’s outcome.
        Returns:
        A cancellable request.
